title: XP installing on Notebook without CD-ROM

forumNotes.content:
Hi,  
I have a notebook that have not any CD-ROM and i try to install XP on its HDD with my FLASH USB .  
Can anyone help me about it ?  
TNX...

forumNotes.author: was_jaclaz
forumNotes.content:
> Thanks about of your comment but after the first boot the file HAL.DLL warning will be appear .

Let's put it in another way.  

Here:  
[http://www.msfn.org/...p-usb-f157.html](http://www.msfn.org/board/install-xp-usb-f157.html "External link")  
There is an entire Forum dedicated to methods to install XP from a USB stick, among which is the WinsetupfromUSB GUI method **maanu** pointed you to.  

These apps were used successfully by several thousands of people.  

There is a Faqs thread here:  
[http://www.msfn.org/...qs-t116766.html](http://www.msfn.org/board/faqs-t116766.html "External link")  

Read them, most probably you are in the situation described in FAQ #4.  

jaclaz

forumNotes.author: Immortal
forumNotes.content:
I found a Russian site that makes it REAL easy.  
1. Have the source ready on HD (xpsp3 or sp2)  
2. Start the prog (WinToFlash)  
3. Choose the source (xpsp3)  
4. Choose destination (usb-drive)  
Wait 10-15 minutes. Done!  

[http://wintoflash.com/](http://wintoflash.com/ "External link")

forumNotes.author: Immortal
forumNotes.content:
Well...I am now sticking to ONE app.  
It is WintoFlash.  
It's the best "out there"  
Concerning Fat32 or NTFS:  
Me, myself and I had problems with NTFS on MY usb-stick!  
It did not work.  
So my thinking is that it is more "safe" to use Fat32.  
Concerning the link twice:  
Only to upset the "police, prosecutor and judge" :-)
